intro: Stachytarpheta galactea, commonly known as the purpletop ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the verbena family (Verbenaceae) and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flower spikes. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine, soft hairs. Stachytarpheta galactea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
